text:
At the height of Evanescence's popularity, "Bring Me to Life," the Goth-y rock song marked by Amy Lee's soaring voice, was nearly impossible to avoid. You knew the lyrics. Your grandma knew the lyrics. Your dog knew the lyrics. What you probably don't know is that since 2003's Falling, which secured their Best New Artist Grammy, Evanescence released another album in 2006. Then…well, not a whole lot. After some internal turmoil, Evanescence announced in 2011 that the band has another record on the way, but we're not holding our breath waiting.

Verdict: Cursed
title: Is Winning the Best New Artist Grammy Award a Curse? A Look at What Happened to the Past 11 Winners

og.description: Mariah Carey, Cyndi Lauper, Christina Aguilera and even the Beatles are all past winners of the coveted Grammy Award for Best New Artist--and with very good reason. But how about Milli Vanilli, Lauryn Hill and Arrested Development? They stood at that same podium, yet their resumes look a whole lot emptier. So, let's settle this once and for all: Is winning the Best New Artist Grammy really a curse?
og.title: Is Winning the Best New Artist Grammy Award a Curse? A Look at What Happened to the Past 11 Winners
